The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
19 
 
JULIA 
Beds are a good thing, old man, I keep telling you. So are baths. 
 
TREVOR 
You see what I’ve got to put up with, Mr Sims? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I, um... Yeah, it’s... What do you do for money? 
 
JULIA 
Sorry? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I-I j-just … I doubt roaming around killing things pays all that well. What, what 
do you do to support yourself? 
 
JULIA 
Oh, I don’t know, we find ways. When you’re out here, the odd bit of robbery 
or trespass doesn’t really phase you. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And why America? 
 
TREVOR 
Heard tell there were a wolfman. Old Davies down in Plymouth swore blind his 
brother had seen one up the Pacific Crest Trail. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
20 
 
JULIA 
I told Trevor he was a liar, but here we are anyway. Have been for a couple of 
years. 
 
TREVOR 
Hey now, no wolfman, sure, but there’s been plenty out here what needs 
killing. 
 
JULIA 
True enough. Plus, it’s hard to leave – we’re not exactly here legally and trying 
to get a flight home would get us noticed by authorities we’d rather avoid. 
 
TREVOR 
I keep telling her we could hop a boat. 
 
JULIA 
And I tell him I’d rather stay hunting here than trap myself on a boat for two 
weeks. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
So, what have you— 
 
(Deep breath) 
 
MAX 
(Rasping) Shut up! 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
21 
 
TREVOR 
Hey, look who’s talking! 
 
MAX 
(Struggling to talk) You could have at least chopped my ears off too. You 
people just won’t shut up. How am I supposed to get the lungs lined up right 
when I can’t even concentrate? 
 
JULIA 
Happy to chop them off again if you need the practice. 
 
MAX 
Do it. You’re the ones who want to talk. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Why were you looking for me? 
 
MAX 
Why do you think? Out here, exposed, unaware, on your own, at least I 
thought so – thought it was a good chance to get you home, to get you ready 
for the dance. 
 
JULIA 
Is this that “unknowing dance”? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Yeah. Ok, Mustermann, or whatever your name— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
22 
 
 
MAX 
Just turn it off. You got more questions, you turn that thing off. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I don’t think you’re in any position to make demands. 
 
MAX 
Maybe not, but are you sure you know what’s listening in? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Do you? 
 
MAX 
No, but I don’t like it. 
 
TREVOR 
What’s he mean, “listening in”? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Wh— No, I, I’m not... 
 
JULIA 
I knew this was a bad idea. Turn it off. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
It, it’s fine, it’s never bee— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG109 – Nightfall 
 
23 
 
 
JULIA 
(Articulating slowly) Turn it off. 
 
(Click)
